title: Double Negatives Quiz
description: Two negatives don't make a positive in grammar! Learn to spot and correct double negative errors.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a double negative?
What is a double negative?
options: Using two negative words in the same clause, which is nonstandard
Using a negative word at the end of a sentence
A sentence with no negatives at all

questions.question: Which correction fixes the double negative? 'She can't hardly wait.'
options: Both A and B are correct

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: I didn't see none of them.

questions.question: Which word is a 'hidden' negative that can create a double negative with 'not'?
Fix: 'He doesn't know nothing about cars.'
options: He doesn't knows nothing about cars.
Both A and B are correct
He doesn't know anything about cars.

questions.question: Which sentence has a double negative?
Is the sentence 'I can't get no satisfaction' grammatically standard?
options: No, it contains a double negative.
It is only correct in British English.

questions.question: Which word should replace 'nothing' to fix the double negative? 'We won't do nothing.'
Can double negatives ever be used intentionally in standard English?
options: Yes, for understatement or litotes (e.g., 'not uncommon')

questions.question: Fix: 'I haven't got no complaints.'
options: Both A and B are correct

questions.question: Which sentence contains a subtle double negative?
In some languages, double negatives are standard. In standard English, they are generally ___.
